session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: To what extent do you support or oppose upzoning policies that allow for higher density housing in traditionally single-family neighborhoods? Please explain your reasoning.
column3: I support up zoning, when done carefully, building more homes will help increase the supply of homes that will lead to the reduction of prices for rental, which will see less people having difficulty to own homes a its now

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: What do you think are the most significant impacts, positive or negative, of increasing housing density in residential neighborhoods?
column3:
The first positive impact it will have is, people will find a place to live for rent at a lower cost. also, it will bring shops, buses and services nearby.

negative impact is that, when not managed well, it causes more traffic noise and crowded schools.

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: How do you think upzoning policies might affect housing affordability in urban areas?
column3: It depends on how the rules are made, when there are more places to live, prices may not rise as fast. this will give people more choices, which can intern lower the rent and stop it from going too high

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: What impact do you believe increased housing density might have on neighborhood character and quality of life?
column3:
it has both positive and negative impacts. 
Things like new shops, better buses, and more energy in the area, just to mention some of the good things. it can also have a negative impact like there might be congested places and services

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: How do you think upzoning might affect transportation systems and traffic congestion in cities?
column3: yes, it will greatly affect

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: What role do you believe local government should play in regulating housing development and density?
column3: I think local government should help make sure housing is fair, safe, and planned well. They should allow new homes when needed, but also listen to people who live in the area. They should make sure there are enough schools and public amenities

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: How might environmental concerns factor into decisions about urban density and zoning?
column3: The government should plan well on how to regulate the environmental pollution, they can implement laws like garbage collection and fines then environmental laws are violated

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: What economic effects, both positive and negative, might result from changing zoning laws to allow more multi-family housing?
column3: There will be positive economic effects, e.g.  more homes can create jobs in building and fixing homes, more people living in an area can help local shops and business to grow increasing income and living standards

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: How do you think the interests of current residents versus future residents should be balanced when making zoning decisions?
column3: While its important to listen to current residents of the city, others also deserve an equal opportunity to leave in city, the government can work in hand with both parties to agree on the best solution.

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: What role do you think social equity and access to opportunity play in discussions about zoning and housing policy?
column3: They mean making sure everyone, no matter their income or background, can find a good place to live. housing rules should help reduce unfairness and give more people access to jobs, schools and services.

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: How confident are you that changes in Housing Supply lead to changes in Support for Upzoning? Does it have a positive effect (increasing it) or a negative effect (decreasing it)? How strong is this effect?
column3: I am somewhat confident that changes in housing supply affect support for upzoning. When more homes are available, people may support zoning more because it helps with housing needs. So, the effect is mostly positiveâ€”it increases support. This effect might not be very strong for everyone. Some people may still worry about traffic or neighborhood changes even if housing improves. Overall, more housing supply usually helps people feel better about upzoning, but other concerns can also influence their opinions.

session_1747319064920_rhzhstb: What factors do you think influence Support for Upzoning, and how strong is their impact? Please also indicate if these influences are positive (increasing) or negative (decreasing).
column3:
some of the positive factors include more affordable housing, better access to public transport and shops, and housing options. negative impacts are like: traffic and parking worries, changes to neighborhoods feel and crowded school and services

affordable housing and housing shortage usually have strong positive effects. Traffic and neighborhood worries can also strongly reduce support, depending on the person
